1. Identify all spiral galaxies in the table by looking at the object type column. In this case, there are two rows (5408 and 5474) with "spiral galaxy".
2. Look up the apparent magnitude of each spiral galaxy in the table. The apparent magnitudes for the two spiral galaxies are 14.0 (row 5408) and 11.9 (row 5474).
3. Compare the values found in step 2. If a smaller number is found, it indicates a brighter object (less apparent magnitude), so the claim would be FALSE. However, if a larger number is found, it indicates a dimmer object (higher apparent magnitude), so the claim would be TRUE.
4. Since the value for the apparent magnitude of the spiral galaxy in row 5474 (11.9) is greater than the value for the apparent magnitude of the spiral galaxy in row 5408 (14.0), the claim is FALSE.
